description: Since the only proper food courts we've had in the city have been at Crescat, Excel World, Liberty and Majestic City - it's with great relief that we welcome the new one at the brand spanking new Arcade Independence Square. We think the atmosphere especially and the food here is a little notch above that of your average Colombo food court.
name: Arcade Food Court
Yum Yum Fine Foods
description: Yum Yum does a huge range of imported nuts and candies. Everything from dried kiwis to marshmallows to almonds to nachos.

name: Taprobane (Cinnamon Grand)
description: Taprobane's dinner buffet is pretty awesome. For just Rs. 2200, the spread's large and the food's top quality. Highlights? Their egg hoppers and their chocolate fudge.
MEX is Casa's new traditional Mexican restaurant which replaces HVN.
name: MEX

description: We've had quite a few new ice cream parlors pop up over the past few years (no complaints from us!), but Il Gelato still reigns supreme when it comes to high quality ice cream. There's just this small issue of having to empty your wallet for a few scoops..
name: Il Gelato

description: The Dewatagaha mosque is one of the more prominent mosques in Colombo - its lovely exterior is almost an iconic part of the architecture near Town Hall. It is also partly a shrine to a Saint from the 19th century - Shaikh Usman Waliyullah - and Muslims and non-Muslims alike visit to pay their respects.
address: Dr C. W. W. Kannangara Mawatha, Colombo 7
name: Dewatagaha Mosque (Shaikh Usman Waliyullah Shrine)
Raja Bojun
address: Liberty Arcade, 282, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
description: Raja Bojun is generally known for good Sri Lankan cuisine. They've moved from their old spot near Galle Face to a new location at the top of Liberty Arcade. The food is still good, so is the spread, though nothing amazing. We loved the seafood best.

The Floor By O! has been around for a while now, we've been there before and we find ourselves going back more. With very reasonable prices, competent staff and good music, they seem to know what they're doing.
name: The Floor by O!
Maharaja Palace
description: Maharaja Palace is one of the few fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. The prices are high but the portions are actually quite large now. Their food was always pretty good and it seems they've made some necessary improvements.
Chapters has a decent range of books, mostly fantasy and illustration, but what we really love about this bookshop is it's so much more than a store.
name: Chapters

description: Shirohana is a popular chain of flower shops that's been around since 1983 - it's one of our favourite flower shops in the city though they're pretty expensive.
name: Shirohana Atelier (Bambalapitiya)
DJ Aquarium
description: DJ Aquarium is unfortunately not the name of a cool new hipster music-mixer as we would have loved to imagine - it's a little pet shop on Galle Road that sells birds and fish.

name: Rasa Malaysia
address: Mount Lavinia beach, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia
description: Rasa Malaysia is a relatively new restaurant down the Mount Lavinia beach stretch, alongside common beach food names like Steam Boat and Loon Tao. The ambience by the beach is obviously awesome, and the food is alright - but we fell in love with their hot butter cuttlefish.

Galleria is the self proclaimed "Mini Department Store'' at the newly opened Arcade- Independence Square. They've got a good selection of globally renowned brands, but don't expect the stuff to be cheap.
address: No 23-26, 1st Floor, Arcade- Independence Square, Colombo 07
name: Galleria

description: Great Wall has been around for a while now, but they're mostly known for their take out. We dropped by for lunch to see how they match up against the growing number of Chinese restaurants in Colombo.
name: Great Wall

description: The Odel store near Townhall is pretty well known now, mostly to Colombo's high-end shopaholics. Their brand is a household name (if your house is in Colombo 7) and you can get top quality clothes, shoes, accessories, perfume and books here - but you'll generally be expected to spend 2K at the very least.
name: ODEL
In On The Green
description: Inn On The Green is well known for it's British Pub-like atmosphere and Pub Quiz .

name: The Boulevard
description: The Boulevard, formerly a cafe/restuarant, has been completely revamped into what we'd consider one of the top Thai restaurants in Colombo. With chef Mama (former head chef at Royal Thai) at the fore, as well as some outstanding food, this is one place to keep an eye on.
As far as beach bars go, Shore By O! is by far the most popular. Not all their drinks are excellent, but they do the best beer cocktails around and their bites aren’t too shabby either.
name: The Shore By O!

description: The Manhattan Fish Market has delicious seafood and ridiculously friendly stuff - it's an awesome place to dine at if you can handle the bill.
name: The Manhattan Fish Market

description: Peach Valley is an old favourite when it comes to Sri Lankanized Chinese in Colombo. While the food itself hasn't changed much the recent renovations have done a great deal to help the look and feel of the place.
name: Peach Valley
Xilaton
description: Xilaton is a Chinese restaurant in Bambalapitiya - the service is good and so is the food. We're especially fans of their hot garlic prawns which - get this - are slathered in cheese.

name: Tsukiji  Uoichi
address: Arcade Independence Square, Clock Tower 1st Floor, Independence Square, Colombo 7
description: Over a year since first opening its doors Tsukiji Uoichi is still going strong. They've got one of the most impressive Japanese menus in Colombo and they're execution is excellent. Their prices are on the higher end but the food is well worth it and the service is as efficient as it gets.

name: Chennai
description: Ever been to one of those places where you ate so much, you had to just stop and rest a bit? Those kind of places are harder to come by now since food in general is too expensive, but at long last we found another in Chennai restaurant. You can pretty much stuff your face full of tasty Indian dishes and it'll cost you less than Rs.400, guaranteed.

Blush is a small clothing store in Bambalapitiya - it's mostly party wear, imports from Hong Kong, Bangkok and Vietnam, and you can get some stuff here that you get in huge department stores but for smaller prices.
name: BLUSH

description: M.D.Gunasena takes a novel approach at the conventional bookshop, with gorgeous interior decor, and a chill atmosphere which is perfect for passing the time, and of course reading.
name: M. D. Gunasena Bookshop (Bambalapitiya)
Arabian Knights
description: After an initial hiccup, Arabian Knights has bounced back well. The food is nearly back to their former glory, and coupled with the new venue, things are looking up again.

Borderlands Sri Lanka, a camp in Kithulgala that makes it possible for a lot of us to get into adventure sports, has their store Edge Sri Lanka in Kirulapone - where you can go to get geared up for some epic outdoor activity.
name: Edge Sri Lanka

description: The German Toy Museum is Gayangi von Heimendahl's personal collection of toys - dolls, cars, train sets, you name it - from Germany, over the span of 35 years.
name: German Toy Museum

description: The Sambodhi Chaithya is a beautiful temple built on top of two impressive intersecting concrete arches.
name: Sambodhi Chaithya

description: So the Sri Lankan Air Force runs a salon in Borella. Yep, sounds cool and weird, but it's actually quite ordinary - they do haircuts, styling, facials, manicures, pedicures, massages and wedding stuff.
name: The Clippers

description: Dushy's at the Good Market (Diyatha Uyana) is a small new stall that sells yummy organic health food. We tried out what they had, and we left stuffed, and not feeling guilty for a change!
name: Dushy's (Good Market)
address: Stall No.146, Good Market ,Diyatha Uyana, Battaramulla

name: The Cakery
description: The Cakery used to be a resident favourite amongst the plebs at office, but they've long since dwindled in terms of service and food.
This is really a wonderful place for a late afternoon stroll, and it's so busy and well alive with activity that even the most squeamish or superstitious Colombar could hardly be afraid to wander in.
name: Borella Cemetery
Ministry Of Crab (Dutch Hospital)
description: Ministry of Crab is a high-end restaurant on Dutch Hospital premises that specializes in crab cuisine - the food is just plain mouth-watering and the service is good.
Skrumptious has introduced a new flavour to their lineup of brownies. We tried it, and it's pretty darn great.
name: Skrumptious

description: Beemas is a supermarket on the third floor of the Kollupitiya Market building -- it's got a whole bunch of awesome imported quality goodies like Hershey's syrup, Hag's espresso, Hellman's mayonnaise and a whole shelf full of fancy Italian biscuits.
name: Beemas (Kollupitiya Market)

description: Whatever Studio is an awesome little shop in Colombo 7 that showcases exclusively local talent. You can get paintings, cupcakes, clothes, jewellery and household stuff here, designed by Sri Lankan artists.
name: Whatever Studio

description: Branas is a supermarket on the third floor of the Kollupitiya Market building - it's quite similar to Beemas next to it - it's got a whole load of imported stuff from mostly Australia, Dubai and Italy
name: Branas (Kollupitiya Market)

description: If you've ever wondered what's in that long-ass ugly block of a building opposite next to Liberty Cinema - this post is going to take you through it - here you'll find handcrafts, travel agencies, a shipping surveyor, a whole floor of vegetables, another full of butchers, shops that sell colourful buckets and mops, grocery stores, Chinese grocery stores - and then unexpectedly - rare and awesome food products imported from Italy, Australia and the UAE.
address: 65 Srimath Anagarika Dharmapala Mawatha, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka
name: Kollupitiya Market

description: Beira Lake is a nice place to chill out on a cool day - it's a hot spot for couples but there's a great view for anyone to enjoy here especially at night when it's lit up.
address: Beira Lake, James Pieris Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Beira Lake
Light House Galley
description: The Light House Galley opposite Colombo Lighthouse is a courtyard-restaurant run by the Navy - it's a good place for lunch or dinner.

name: Dinemore (Marine Drive)
description: Dinemore in Wellawatte by the sea has got their signature oozing-mayo subs and burgers, with a relaxing view of the ocean.
Latitude at Taj Samudra offers one of the more expensive lunch buffets in Colombo. While they don’t particularly specialise in a particular area, they offer a satisfying spread overall.
address: Taj Samudra, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
name: Latitude (Buffet, Taj)

description: OZO is a hotel that's just popped up on Marine Drive in Bambalapitiya, quite popular for having the highest bar in the city (ON14).
name: OZO Colombo
Acropol
description: Acropol Restaurant which formerly resided on R.A De Mel Mawatha has moved to a new location on Galle Road, Colombo 03. If you're a fan of shawarmas it's worth a visit.
If you're looking for high quality designer menswear, Crocodile is definitely the place you should visit, but remember, high quality comes at a price.
name: Crocodile

description: Arcade Independence Square is yet another super-complex of eateries and shopping outlets to pop up in Colombo since the Racecourse buildings. It's got its own food court, a bunch of places to buy clothes and eat at, and is cushioned on a beautiful green expanse.
name: Arcade Independence Square
Chesa Swiss
address: 3 Deal Place A, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka
description: Sadness, this place is closed

name: Choco Luv
description: This is a confused place. It's barely got anything to do with chocolate.

name: Noodles (Cinnamon Grand)
address: Cinnamon Grand Colombo, 77, Galle Road, Colombo 3
description: Noodles at Cinnamon Grand offers one the most complete dining experiences around the city at a surprisingly affordable price point, while maintaining a high level service.

name: China Doll
description: China Doll, once a fresh entry into the Chinese Restaurant tamasha is no longer the jaw dropping experience it once was.

name: Sandwich Factory - Dehiwala
address: 134/1, Hill Street, Dehiwala Mt Lavinia, Colombo
description: When Sandwich Factory first opened it's doors they were quite a welcomed change to the fast food industry in Sri Lanka with it's 60's American diner theme. They've still got that going for them, although it seems they've lost there enthusiasm over time.
If you're around Kandy, you might want to stop by the National Seminary in Ampitiya - a beautiful expanse of old buildings and wild trees, home to young would-be priests.
name: The National Seminary (Ampitiya)

description: Peradeniya's gardens now titled 'Royal Botanical Gardens' is probably the most popular garden in the country. It spreads through 147 acres and is said to attract close to 2 million visitors every year. It is a glorious expanse of well-kept trees, flowers and pathways, some of which are centuries old.
name: Royal Botanical Gardens (Peradeniya)

description: Cafe Orange Peel is less of a cafe and more of a very sophisticated bath-kadey - it is a popular new stop for the working crowd in Bambalapitiya. Their rice and curry is top class and comes in epic portions.
name: Cafe Orange Peel

description: The Governor's Restaurant at Mt.Lavinia Hotel offers one of the better buffets in the city. We found that mostly everything tasted good, with an exceptional salad bar and arguably the best selection of desserts around.
address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
name: Mount Lavinia Hotel Buffet
Bavarian German Restaurant
description: The Bavarian has been around for ages, and is still hugely popular. Change can be a good thing but sometimes when you're doing something right, you should stick to it, and that's exactly what the German Restaurant has done.
Viharamahadevi Park, known earlier as Victoria Park, is Colombo's only central park. It's been done-up for quite a while now and it looks great, especially in the evenings.
name: Viharamahadevi Park

description: Burger Cart is one of many little burger-kadeys to grace the streets of Colombo, among others like Burger's Hut, Burger's King, et al. Although their burgers aren't of the same calibre (yes, burgers have calibre) as that of Burger's King, they're still pretty tasty, cheap and ideal for the munchies.
name: Burger Cart
address: 423, Union Place, YWCA Jubilee Hall, Colombo 02

description: When Gonuts with Donuts started off they were all the craze. Now many years down the line, the hype has died down, their prices have gone up, but they're still pretty decent.
name: Gonuts With Donuts
address: Dudley Senanayake Mawatha, Colombo 00800, Sri Lanka

description: Sigiri is a small but excellent Sri Lankan restaurant located in Manhattan, New York serving an authentic and impressive representation of Lankan cuisine.
name: Sigiri (Manhattan, New York)
Subway
address: 347, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
description: Swift service and healthy veggie options make Subway a worthy new franchise in Colombo.

You can now go from Colombo to Kandy in 20 minutes if you take the Cinnamon Air sea plane. The view is amazing and it's pretty punctual; the only hold-up if at all is that a one-way ticket will cost you about Rs. 22K (a lot).
address: Waters Edge, 316, Polduwa Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte
name: Cinnamon Air - Kandy Flight

description: Cafe Asiana is an established affordable restaurant down Hill Street that, as the name suggests, serves Sri Lankanized Asian food - their portions are huge and their seafood is spicy and delicious.
name: Cafe Asiana
Tang Dynasty
description: Tang Dynasty  is one of the most authentic ones we've been to, the interior is amazing and the food is top notch.

The Emerald store is a one-stop shop for mens office wear. We'd still like to see their casual selection improve, but for mens polos, shirts and pants they've got you covered. They've got a staff that will help you pick out whatever style you need from their impressive selection, so you won't be leaving disappointed.
name: Emerald Store

description: Drunken Monkey is a popular restaurant and bar in Hikkaduwa, and one of the couple of places that still function during off-season. The food is average but it's a great place to hang out by the beach.
name: Drunken Monkey

description: Playtrix is currently located at the Colombo Racecourse. The review below is for their former location at CR & FC.
name: Playtrix
address: Racecourse Grand Stand, GS08, Reid Avenue Colombo 7

description: If you're in Colombo 7 and you're craving a good biriyani, Raheema is one of the first places that will come to mind. That's exactly the situation we found ourselves in, and we're glad we dropped in.
name: Raheema Hotel
address: Cumaratunga Munidasa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka

name: Empire Cafe
description: Empire Cafe is a little restaurant-cum-cafe housed inside the Olde Empire Hotel, a 200 year old building, right next to the Dalada Maligawa in Kandy. It's a popular tourist hangout, is surprisingly affordable, and has the best chocolate cake we've had in ages.

906 is the name of a Taru Villa in Hikkaduwa - they've also got similarly beautiful holiday-getaways in Bentota and Colombo. 906 is a very comfy, private relaxing space for about six people, the service is awesome, and it's by the beach.
name: 906 (Taru Villas)

description: We've seen their brownies pop up on our news feed more than a few times.  So this time we made it a point to give Treats n Stuff a shot.  We can now see why they've got such a large following.
name: Treats n Stuff
The Bread Company (German Artisan Bakers)
description: The Bread Company does excellent breads, sausages, pickles and more, and they do some of the  best sandwiches in the city and a good breakfast if you want to dine in.

Pedlar's Inn Cafe is a popular stop in Galle fort (and so is their Gelato opposite the cafe) - the food is alright, but mostly it's the ambience that makes this place appealing, though there are better spots with better food in the Fort these days.
name: Pedlar's Inn Cafe
Santoré Bistro Italiano
description: With high quality ingredients, Santoré serves authentic Italian cuisine at a great location.
Queen's Cafe is a very popular fast food stop down Duplication Road that's been around for ages. It was closed for a while awaiting a face lift, but it's now open for business again.
name: Queen's Cafe

description: Colombo's only proper museum (the Dutch museum and the weird old Town Hall one barely come on par) is pretty amazing. This Italianate colonial style building houses statues, artifacts and paintings that go back as far as the 5th century.
name: Colombo National Museum

description: Habitat for Humanity’s goal is to eliminate poverty by providing secure housing.
name: Habitat for Humanity

description: Are you one of those people who would like to pick up stray dogs off the streets and take them all home? YAMU met a bunch of people like that last week at the Girls Guide Association. The type of people who rescue dogs, care for them, sterilise them, feed them and re-home them.
name: Adopt A Dog

description: St Lucia's Cathedral is one of only fifteen cathedrals in the country, and it's one of the most beautiful. It is the center of the Colombo Archdiocese (Roman Catholic) and is more than 200 years old.
address: Bonjean Road, George R De Silva Mawatha, Kotahena
name: St. Lucia's Cathedral

description:
Thusare Talking Hands is an Acupressure Therapy & Training Center where all of the masseurs are partially or fully visually impaired.

Thusare Talking Hands has a twofold objective, one, to provide a service for people who suffer from physical and mental pain caused by a stressful lifestyle and two, to provide employment opportunities for the visually impaired people by training them in Shiatsu (Acupressure).
name: Thusare Talking Hands

description: Honey Pot Salon specializes in waxing. With plenty of wax varieties, trained technicians and a chic ambience, they've managed to make hair removal less awkward and painful.
name: Honey Pot
Domenico's
description: Domenico's, headed by the former chef at Santoré was great addition to Colombo's pizza scene in 2014. Now they've expanded their menu with some much needed meats and it's that much better.

Toby's Estate in Mount Lavinia is a very cosy hangout that serves okay-food that's a little on the pricey side - this international franchise is still best known in Colombo as a coffee stop rather than for its dine-in.
address: Galle Road, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka
name: Toby's Estate

description: The Pettah Floating Market opened on the 25th of August to a lot of hype, and it's worth it. The place is another part of Colombo's fancy urban development plan along with Arcade Independence Square, but much more accessible to everyone. Colombo has never had such an amazing hangout space before, and it's affordable.
name: The Floating Market

description: CLOSED NOW: Just a tiny air-conditioned alcove on the crazily busy Galle road, Sea Salt is an easily overlooked place that serves up brilliant, fresh seafood. Best for delivery/take-away.
name: Sea Salt

description: The Yal Devi is a part of history. It's by no means a quick or luxurious way to the North or back, but it's an interesting journey. It's hot, vibrant and slow - a proper Sri Lankan voyage.
name: Yal Devi

description: The early 17th Century Jaffna Fort was built by the Portuguese, expanded by the Dutch, and destroyed by human aggression. Visit the ruins - a testament to architectural prowess and sheer brutality.
name: Jaffna Fort

description: Colombo Courtyard's design and style are brilliant, as we've mentioned before in the hotel review. It's chic, it's tasteful, and a lot of it is upcycled. The food, on the other hand, leaves a lot to be desired.
name: Colombo Courtyard Poolside

description: Good old UBG, the champion of the executive lunch buffet and the Union Place white collar chap, is no more. In its place is a lobby-bar of sorts with brilliant food and somewhat pricey drinks.
name: Union Bar & Grill (Hilton Residencies)

description: Casa is a building as art, but better even than its nifty finishes is the fact that it’s WELL PRICED.
name: CASA Colombo

description: Perched on top of the OZO Colombo is the equally swanky ON14 Rooftop Lounge & Bar. Pool bar by day and lounge bar by night, ON14 is one of the highest spots for a drink in the city.
address: OZO Colombo Rooftop, 36-38, Clifford Place, Colombo 04
name: ON14 (OZO Colombo)

description: Geoffrey Bawa's impact on Sri Lanka is unparalleled. His legacy as an architect and writer is etched in local history. Lunuganga is arguably the most famous of his works, a country home set in a sprawling lakeside garden estate.
name: Lunuganga (Bentota)

description: Just 30 minutes away, Reef's Edge is the perfect weekend getaway or extended lunch for the city-worn Colombo dweller. It's got a great beachfront location, dedicated staff, vibrant decor, and inspired food,.
name: Reef's Edge - Uswetakeiyawa

description: Mini Mago Inc is a store down Ward Place that has the coolest mini-scale houses you have ever seen. Trudi Malalgoda Amadoru, its meticulous designer, not only makes dollhouses and everything in them but offers custom-made miniature worlds to suit your whimsy.
name: Mini Mago Inc

description: Saraswathie Lodge is another pure-veg South Indian spot on Galle Rd in Bambalapitiya. The ambience isn't as charming as nearby Greenlands Hotel but the thosai is marginally better.
name: Saraswathie Lodge (Bambalapitiya)

description: Triple B's is a cool breakfast place at the Good Market at Racecourse - the pancakes are alright but the real treat is in their syrup and strawberries.
name: Triple B's (Good Market)
Panino (Cotton Collection)
description: Panino specialises in sandwiches. In melts, to be specific. They also have a killer hot sauce.

For candy enthusiasts, Candy Planet in Battaramulla is the holy grail - not only is it affordable but you will find every imaginable type of candy there. It is probably as close as we Sri Lankans will ever get to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory.
name: Candy Planet

description: Good Market has moved to Racecourse, and is held every Saturday now.
name: Good Market (Diyatha Uyana - MOVED)

description: Paan Paan's new branch at Rajagiriya has got the same fresh crisp bread and friendly service that they've maintained at their other branches in Lorenz Road, Alfred House and Havelock Road.
name: Paan Paan (Rajagiriya)
TGI Friday's
description: It's always Friday in here.
Independence Square is a beautiful place to hang out and relax. A lot of people surprisingly don't know that under the Memorial Hall are wooden doors that open into a museum.
name: Independence Memorial Museum

description: Formerly known as Walkers Cafe, The Canteen hasn't changed much at all but their hoppers are excellent.
name: The Canteen
Ceylon Tea Moments
description: Ceylon Tea Moments at the Racecourse building is a really underrated hangout spot - the service is great and the cooks are creative.

name: Island Bagels
address: Chelsea Gardens, off Inner Flower Road, Colombo 3
description: Freshly baked bagels are warm, squashy, and generally delicious. Island Bagels is a brand new home venture so a lot of care and quality goes into each batch.
Che By Relish is a lounge/restaurant that serves well prepared food, is on the high-end, and has its walls covered with Che Guevera memorabilia.
name: Che By Relish

description: Apart from its pool, Otter's strikes this delightful yet confusing mix between being simultaneously family-friendly and being a good place for chaps after work to put a manly arrack session.
address: Otter Aquatic Club, Colombo, 380/1, Bauddhaloka Mawatha, Colombo 8
name: Otter's Aquatic Club

description: The Cozy Linen store is a bedding and linen store in a nice little nook on Queens Road. They have a a variety of elegant interiors for homes and hotels.
name: Cozy Linen
Genghis
description: One of Marine Drive's newer additions, Genghis is a Mongolian BBQ and Grill run by Don Stanleys caterers. It shares a premises and menu with the Fat Crab, and has a lovely view of the Indian Ocean and the coastal railroad.

name: Streat360
description: Streat360 is an interesting little restaurant featuring 'street food' from different countries. The interior is quite chic and rustic, but it's kinda overpriced.

Chutneys serves good South Indian fare, with a menu neatly divided between the four Southern states' vegetarian and non-vegetarian cuisines. The food is quite authentic, with brilliant quality and questionable quantity.
name: Chutneys  (Cinnamon Grand)

description: This lonely island/isthmus just before Tangalle is a beautiful spot, well worth a stop as you're driving down the coast. At low tide (around sunset) you can walk/wade across a spit of land and be surrounded by sea and beauty on all sides.
name: Tangalla Bay
The Bayleaf
description: As far as safe bets go, Bayleaf is right up there. Good Italian fare at not too exorbitant prices, and a rather extensive menu to choose from.
Fits' Margosa in Chunnakam, Jaffna is an elegant refurbished 19th Century mansion about 9km away from the main town, and possibly one of the only upscale hotels at the very North.
address: Station Road, Urelu North, Chunnakam, Jaffna
name: Fits Pavilion Margosa (Jaffna)

description: Royal Thai is a great celebratory option. With delicious food and impeccable service, it's definitely one of Colombo's reigning dining royalty.
name: Royal Thai (Cinnamon Lakeside)
address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115 Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2

description: For a boutique experience without being completely isolated, this is a great spot. Lovely villa within 15 minutes of Galle, Thalpe and Una and about an hour and a half from Colombo.
address: Babaragoda Road, off Akuressa Road, Galle
name: Templeberg Villa
Poppy Hana
address: Liberty Arcade, R. A. de Mel Mawatha, Colombo 3.
description: Poppy Hana, with their sushi conveyer belt is a fun place to dine, but the sushi itself wasn't fresh.
Great Wall has been around for a while now, but they're mostly known for their take out. We dropped by for lunch to see how they match up against the growing number of Chinese restaurants in Colombo.
name: Great Wall
Mangos (Jaffna)
description: A pure vegetarian North & South Indian restaurant, cafe and bakery, Mangos is one of those famous Jaffna joints that warrants a visit and a mention.
Hotel Rolex and its misleading name are an experience not to be missed whilst in Jaffna. Hot, juicy biriyanis and sugary juices. This is legit Northern saivar kade territory.
name: Hotel Rolex (Jaffna)

description: If you’re looking for a quick way to get across the country in luxury with a view you can’t find anywhere else, Cinnamon Air is your best bet.
address: Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake, Sri Lanka
name: Cinnamon Air – Sigiriya Flight
Ceylon Tea Moments
description: Ceylon Tea Moments at the Racecourse building is a really underrated hangout spot - the service is great and the cooks are creative.
Perched on top of the OZO Colombo is the equally swanky ON14 Rooftop Lounge & Bar. Pool bar by day and lounge bar by night, ON14 is one of the highest spots for a drink in the city.
address: OZO Colombo Rooftop, 36-38, Clifford Place, Colombo 04
name: ON14 (OZO Colombo)
Burger King (Colpetty)
description: A well run Burger King franchise with a nice location (second floor balcony) in Colpetty. They also have interesting local options like spicy chicken and rice now.

name: McDonald's (Colpetty)
description: As a food, McDonald's is pretty processed and nothing special, but as an experience it still has a real place in the global psyche. Sometimes you just want McDonald's. In that case the Colpetty outlet serves the usual McD fare with a few Sri Lankan twists.

name: Rio Ice Cream (Jaffna)
description: The original Rio Ice Cream parlour is old and sweet- it's persisted through decades of war and strife as an integral part of the local community. It's worth a diabetic shock or two to experience that.

name: Yarl Eat House
description: The Yarl Eat House is perhaps Sri Lanka's best street-diner, serving spicy crab, prawns, mutton and cuttlefish along with a solid rice and curry, all for a reasonable price.

name: The Brick Lane Cookie Company (Crescat)
description: The Brick Lane Cookie Companie serves fresh cookies between the escalators of the Crescat Mall. It's a quick and tasty bite you can grab on your way up or down.
Vijitha Yapa Crescat has a great selection of comics and other interesting books, but it's also quite expensive. Good for gifts.
name: Vijitha Yapa (Crescat)

description: China Doll runs a reliable and good delivery service. It's not your usual Chinese (no MSG for example) but it's creative, tasty and original.
name: China Doll (Delivery)

description: Located on the top floor of Crescat, Linen & Life does a lovely range of linen clothing for men and women. Prices range from about Rs. 3000 to Rs. 5500.
name: Linen & Life

description: One of Sri Lanka's original South Coast boutique luxury hotels.
name: Aditya

description: Maalu Maalu was the first resort to be developed on the then deserted Kalkudah beach in Passikudah and it quickly became one of the go to places in the area. Its iconic thatched chalets are a distinctive sight on the now more populated coastline.
name: Maalu Maalu Resort & Spa

description: A worthy and chocolate heavy addition to our reviews of Colombo home bakers. Very tasty and indulgent sweets, mainly brownies.
name: Dark Temptations (Home Baker)
Gami Gedara
description: Healthy and tasty juices for Rs. 200.

name: Mintage Restaurant & Pub
description: A chilled out place in the heart of Colombo for a nibble and drink after work with friends, which doesn't require you to dress up or shell out serious dough.
Clique isn’t the cheapest watering hole in the city. However, it does bring something new to Colombo’s severely tired and monopolized club scene.
name: Clique Lounge Bar

description: Lakpahana is still a classic for traditional gifts (sarongs, demon masks, painted elephants). It's a central location and not too over-priced, especially if you dig.
name: Lakpahana
Allora (Galle) - Closed For Off-Season
description: Smack in the middle of Sri Lanka’s prettiest colonial areas, the Galle Fort, Allora is an absolute delight. Serving a range of Italian food and located on the cross of good old Pedlar’s Street and Lighthouse Street, the restaurant is a good spot to grab a nibble while on an artsy walk around the historic Fort.

Most vendors at the Good Market have come out of humble households. Northern Palmyrah Trading comes from Jaffna and sells, as its name suggests, products of the Sri Lankan palmyrah (Borassus fabelliformis).
name: Northern Palmyrah Trading
address: Diyatha Uyana, Battaramulla/ 250/1/09, 1st Floor, Liberty Plaza

name: The Long Bar (Waters Edge)
address: Water's Edge, 316 Ethul Kotte Road, Battaramulla, Colombo
description: The Long Bar at Water's Edge has lovely location and pretty good food and drinks
Near the Palm Villa, there's a nice swimmable beach and a big climbable rock.
name: Palm Villa Beach (Mirissa)

description: On the side of Baseline Road in Narahenpita there's a wall mural depicting hell/the underworld and all the terrible torments that await (beheadings, eye pokings, punching in the stomach). If you're stopped in traffic it's kinda amazing.
name: Hell Wall (Narahenpita)

description: Casuarina Beach is the go-to beach for Jaffna locals. Don't expect a bikinis-and-beers sort of scene.
name: Casuarina Beach (Jaffna)
That Cafe
description: That Cafe is a hard-working new spot in Wellawatte. The food and service is good but they don’t have an extensive menu yet since they opened recently.
There are several small scale fish markets scattered across Jaffna, and the one in Pannai is always a hub of activity.
name: Pannai Fish Market (Jaffna)
Carmello
description: Carmello serves up local and somewhat artificial ice cream and gelato. It's a tiny shop opposite Havelock City.

name: Verandah Bistro & Bar
description: The Verandah Bistro is a lesser known hotel restaurant on the third floor of the Hilton Residences. It does average hotel food with a nice poolside view.

name: Green Cabin
description: Providing the city with crispy white hoppers and tongue burning katta sambol for well over 60 years, Green Cabin is one of Colombo's older, more venerable eating establishments.

name: Salad Guru
description: Salad Guru is a fun little new enterprise trying its wings at the Good Market. Run by a trained nutritionist, the stall has a whole range of stuff that’s good for you. They range from salads, pastas and soups to quiches and healthy tacos.

Colombo wants for good Italian options. While there’s no lack of Italian restaurants none of them quite does justice to the real gusti d’italia  It’s not that Bayleaf, Il Ponte, Echo are bad exactly – just that they aren’t quite good enough. On occasion though Colombo’s wannabe trattorias can surprise you with the quality of their cooking. The other day we stepped into Echo and discovered they serve up a very respectable anti pasti buffet for Rs. 1200+.
name: Echo (Cinnamon Grand)
Pedlar's Inn Gelato (Galle)
description: Gelato down Pedlar's Street
Splash is the biggest retailer in the Middle East, now with a space in K-Zone, Ja-Ela.
name: Splash (K-Zone)

description: Geeth has a small boat which keeps you close to the action - sightings of whales, dolphins and immersion in the great expanse of the ocean.
name: Whale Watching Mirissa With Geeth
Riviera Resort (Batticaloa)
address: New Dutch Bar Road, Kallady, Batticaloa
description: Just across the Kallady Bridge in Batticaloa, the Riviera serves up a good rice and curry, as well as crab and other local specialities.

Uga Bay is one of Passikudah's hotel giants, located on a vast property spanning a significant breadth of the town's broad and beautiful beach. It's a five star, so you can expect good food, comfy beds and searing hot showers.
name: Uga Bay (Passikudah)

description: The Batticaloa Science Museum is not a very good museum and it smells funny (probably because of the generally live sea creatures in tanks) but it's interesting in its own way.
name: Museum Of Natural History And Science (Batticaloa)

description: Cinnamon Air's flight to Batticaloa is the best way to get there. It's also pretty expensive. If you can afford it, do it.
name: Cinnamon Air - Batticaloa Flight

description: If MIA went shopping in Sri Lanka, we think Central Road in Batticaloa would be her spot. They have a raucous riot of colorful clothing for sale up and down the street.
name: Central Road Shopping (Batticaloa)
Simply Strawberries By Jagro (Cotton Collection)
description: Simply Strawberries makes wonderful desserts and their new outlet on Dharmapala Mawatha serves the same products in a more central and less busy location. Win.
Tintagel is a historic Colombo establishment with chic design and generally good (but pricey) food at its al fresco restaurant.
name: The Courtyard (Tintagel Boutique Hotel)
YUMI (Taj Samudra)
address: Taj Samudra, 25 Galle Face Center Rd, Colombo 3
description: YUMI is Taj Samudra's resident Japanese restaurant. What they lack in terms of variety they make up for with some delicious, specialized sushi in arguably the best setting for a Japanese restaurant in Colombo.

name: The Paddington
description: The new address they relocated to is easily accessible and there is plenty of parking. From a food POV, it may not impress everyone but the place sure is somewhere we can all relax at.
Yo-Mo has a new outlet at ODEL. It's essentially located in the car park, where Anything.lk used to be.
name: Yo-Mo (ODEL)

description: Palm Villa is one of the best places to stay in Mirissa, if you can get it. Reasonable room rates, interesting rooms, swimmable beach and a reasonable distance from the main strip.
name: Palm Villa Hotel (Mirissa)

description: Délicieux is a vegan home baker based roughly out of Nugegoda. Despite not using milk or eggs, she makes some tasty sweets.
name: Délicieux (Vegan Home Baker)

description: EV Lanka sells electric vehicles, starting with the Nissan Leaf.
name: EV Lanka (Electric Cars)
Barracuda
description: We had a great time here. It's a friendly spot on the beach, very near Colombo, with good Chinese food. Doesn't get much better.
If you're staying in Batticaloa town itself, this is the spot (as long as you don't mind basic accommodation). It's cheap, the staff are insanely nice, and the lawn and location can't be beat.
name: Lanka Rest Housess (Batticaloa)

description: For us it's sort of an ironic pleasure, but the service at the Global Towers bar is actually quite good and the cocktails are good (food not so much). The Indian karaoke is amazing and it's an interesting way to get that airport vibe in the city.
name: Beach Club Bar (Global Towers)
Whight & Co
description: Whight & Co is amazing for coffee. They've got Cold Drip down to a science. The food is alright, too.
address: Marine Drive and Aloe Avenue, Colombo 3

name: Paan Paan Sandwich Bar
description: Paan Paan makes great bread which turns into great sandwiches, melts. etc. It's not cheap but you're getting good, healthy value for money.
Lighthouse is one place that we actually felt bad leaving. The hotel is really connected to its location so you feel quite comfortably wrapped in the sunset and beach. Truly an iconic hotel.
name: Jetwing Lighthouse
Ginza On The Edge (Waters Edge)
description: Ginza On The Edge is the suburban successor to the Hilton’s  Ginza Hohsen. It's on the 1st floor of Waters Edge and offers high-end Japanese with excellent service to boot.

name: Korean Barbecue KBQ
description: KBQ in Rajagiriya does fried chicken and noodles, with a Korean twist.

name: Serendib (Negombo)
description: One of the Negombo strip’s more popular little bar/restaurants, Serendib is right on the beach and has a regular stream of visitors. It strikes a fine balance between dodgy and nice.
One of Colombo’s prettier urban escapes, Colombo Courtyard is a boutique hotel in the heart of Colpetty. As it avoids the usual business hotel tag, the vibe is entirely different.
address: Alfred House Road, Colombo 00300, Sri Lanka
name: Colombo Courtyard
Kosgoda Sea Turtle Conservation Project
description: Turtle hatcheries are good for the environment, save lives, and incredibly fun. There are a few lovely ones down the coast, especially in and around the Kosgoda area. We visited the Kosgoda Sea Turtle Conservation Project this weekend.

Started by Cherine Amarasinghe and her husband Karu, Cherine’s Quench caters bottles of delicious icy beverages – ice coffee, naarang juice, and gingerbeer. Using all natural ingredients and bottled daily, the drinks are fresh and don’t contain any additives.
name: Cherine's Quench
Cafe On The 5th
description: Cafe On The 5th has been a local favourite for years, serving tasty food in a comfortable al fresco style atmosphere. Their quality has taken a nose-dive recently, though.

name: Kash's Kitchen (Ambalantota)
description: Kash's Kitchen is a very clean restaurant and pastry shop in Ambalantota. It serves great rice and curry and short eats at affordable prices.
Caked is a home bakery specialising in french macarons, cupcakes and cakes. French macarons are notoriously difficult to master, but they do an excellent job.
name: Caked

description: PR is the fashion extension of Paradise Road on Horton Place. They have a really interesting and local collection of designer wear, which is great if you can afford it.
name: PR

description: At the forefront of Sri Lanka's new wave of art and artists this is really the only dedicated, permanent gallery space in the city. It's not attached to a cafe, they don't run art classes- it’s a professional art gallery everyday of the week
name: Saskia Fernando Gallery
Crusty's
description: Crusty's makes some pretty good and relatively healthy subs.
The old Alerics is finally back with a new location in (the also new) Liberty Arcade. It's a bit artificial, but good for a hot day's treat.
name: Alerics

description: 41 Sugar might be pricier than  other contemporary bars, but both its cocktails and food are honestly excellent. With an excellent rooftop setting to boot, the only thing they really need to fix is the attitude of their staff.
name: 41 Sugar

description: Colombo has a few party supply stores, but most of the products are not of especially high quality. Party Station is a new shop in the new Liberty Arcade which has glow sticks, balloons, party hats, costumes - basically whatever you'd need for any celebration.
name: The Party Station

description: Park Street Mews Restaurant is one of those select few that have managed to remain relevant and maintain high standards throughout the years. They haven't changed much at all, but we're fine with that since the food is excellent, the service is fast and the unorthodox setting is still quite chic.
name: Park Street Mews Restaurant

description: If you are taking the scenic cruise to Negombo rather than hammering along the highway, the Club Restaurant is a nice place to stop. Basic beer and bite in semi-isolated huts, but the killer thing is the view.
name: The Club Restaurant And Beer Garden

description: Kingfisher remains a culinary hotspot in Unawatuna, though it's not the hidden gem it used to be. It's now an extremely popular beachside restaurant serving up reliably good fare.
name: Kingfisher (Unawatuna)
Gloria Jean's Coffees
description:
(Reopened)
Gloria Jean's has made a comeback despite the scandals surrounding their local franchises. They're at Horton Place now where the old Barista used to be, a few steps across the road from Coffee Bean right next to the W Lounge.
The Mount Head Shop is a tiny place past Templars Road with a good selection of rolling papers, pipes, bongs and other smoking accessories.
name: Mount Head Shop
Harbour Court (Kingsbury)
description: The Kingsbury buffet is pretty good. It's the best in terms of salads and veg, highly competitive in seafood, and good for everything else. It's Rs. 3,500 all in. We think it's good value.

The old Town Hall is a gothic-type Dutch building at the end of Main Street in Pettah. Inside it is a creepy museum of life-size dolls sitting around a wooden table in different postures: a replica of a council meeting in 1906.
name: Old Town Hall
Samagi Cream House And Food Corner
description: Mirissa food options are somewhat lacking. If you're craving a solid rice and curry, this is the place.

Small shops usually gain popularity for selling the same factory extras as the bigger stores, but at much lesser prices. The trick is to find a store that matches your taste in clothes. Mood, a new clothing store on Thimbirigasyaya Road, checked the tick box in both cases.
name: MoOD

description: Talpe Beach Resort serves tasty, intelligent food in a beautiful location on the beach. We're calling this beach fine dining cause the food has high attention to detail and you can wear a swimsuit.
name: Talpe Beach Restaurant
London Grill  (Cinnamon Grand)
description: A first class fine dining experience. Perfect for when you want to pull out all the stops and celebrate. Primarily a steakhouse.

The Piero House in Thalpe truly is an artists residence. It's a magical space, creatively decorated and an ideal retreat for writers, artists, or general creatives. It's bikable distance to good restaurants in Thalpe and swimmable beach and you get a huge space for around Rs. 9,000 (double).
name: The Artist's Residence - Piero House (Thalpe)

description: The Fat Crab on Marine Drive is well known for their seafood.
name: The Fat Crab

description: As far as beach bars go, Shore By O! is by far the most popular. Not all their drinks are excellent, but they do the best beer cocktails around and their bites aren’t too shabby either.
name: The Shore By O!

description: f you want real pork products, Fat Guy BBQ does them. As long as you don't mind the smoky taste that comes with, well, smoking meat, it's a tasty and authentic choice.
name: Fat Guy BBQ
Kami Maki
description: Kami Maki is a Japanese fusion restaurant in Bamabalapitiya. While it's not the most authentic Japanese in town, they do offer some interesting fusion dishes.
The Om Space is a yoga studio located off Havelock Road, near the Royal Institute.
name: The Om Space

description: At the end of Main Street, Pettah, there is a forgotten museum. The Old Town Hall Museum houses a variety of very heavy memorabilia from the city's past - steam-rollers, street signs, printing presses, manhole covers. It's both mundane and wonderful, housed in an open and elegant space, ignored by the swirling commerce around.
name: The Old Town Hall Museum
Moon River
description: Besides one dish, Moon River gave us nothing to be happy about. We honestly cannot recommend it with all the new alternatives in Colombo.
CLOSED: This isn't really a shop and it's only open seasonally, but Daya Perera has the best (and cheapest) Christmas decorations
address: 26/1 Col T. G. Jayawardena Mawatha (entrance from Palm Grove), Colombo 3
name: Daya Perera Christmas Decor (CLOSED)

description: Paradise Road Cafe is one of our favourite haunts, cocooned in a small, white, quiet space atop a lovely store full of antiques and art. The food and coffee are very good, and it's an excellent book nook.
name: Paradise Road Cafe

description: Naniyori is good value for money.  Decent dine-in at Nawala and best sushi delivery in Colombo.
name: Naniyori
Mitsi's Delicacies
description: Mitsi's Cafe was one of those hidden gems we uncovered in 2013. One year down the line, the food is still good, the service is friendly and the desserts are exceptional.

name: Mitsi's Delicacies
description: Mitsi's Cafe was one of those hidden gems we uncovered in 2013. One year down the line, the food is still good, the service is friendly and the desserts are exceptional.
Barefoot Cafe is the best place to hang out in Colombo. It's a chilled place to meet or make friends, see art, hear music, eat good food and drink affordable beer.
name: The Barefoot Cafe
Sisira Bakers
description: This not-so-little bakery is Ragama’s answer to Dinemore, McDonalds, Roots and KFC.

name: Perera & Sons
description: It must be said that somewhere on the journey from family bakers to mega-chain standards fell. The cream buns nowadays just arent the same

name: Hazari's
description: Hazari's has managed to maintain their Middle-Eastern standard while moving to their new Marine Drive location.

Keells Super at Crescat Mall (in the basement to be precise) is one of the most internationally patronized in the city. As such, they have one of the cities best selections of cheese, meat and condiments, though their fruits and vegetables are nothing special.
name: Crescat Keells Super
Burger King (Mount Lavinia)
description: To quote the Notorious BIG, it looks like Softlogic is representing BK to the fullest. The Whopper tastes authentic, the service is competent and the location is well equipped and smart. The restaurant doesn't go beyond the usual Burger King flavor, but it's not supposed to. It's very new, but we'd say that this franchise hits the mark.
Jungle Beach is a secluded beach in Unawatuna that's growing less secluded all the time. It's still a nice and relatively peaceful Una beach off the main strip.
name: Jungle Beach (Unawatuna)
Machang (Bentota)
description: Uncomplicated, tasty food and fresh icy Lion beer in a sleepy coastal town.
A lovely boutique hotel, impeccably furnished and right on Kosgoda beach.
address: Sri Gnanawimala Mawatha, Kosgoda, Sri lanka
name: Saffron & Blue (Jetwing)

description: Hidden in Pettah there's a large and full-featured photo supply shop. As a bonus, they also sell telescopes.
address: 66-2/6 1st Rohini Ln, off Front Street, Colombo 11
name: Sense Photo

description: Cocoon Cafe is a really cool new place to hangout even though the food we tried is so so.
name: Cocoon Cafe
Oro 1889
description: With straightforward, authentic Neapolitan pizzas made in a wood-fired oven and simple yet chic décor, the family-run Oro 1889 is a treat.
Stick No Bills has a sick collections of posters and prints at different price points. They've preserved some really cool artwork and design and are worth a visit (in the Galle Fort).
name: Stick No Bills (Galle)

description: Yet another of the Good Market's fabulous finds, the Ceylan Crêperie is a superb nomadic little stall that started up few years ago. The French owner Noémi is effervescent and passionate about her product. Follow her on Facebook or Instagram to know where to find her next and to enjoy her yummy crêpes.
name: Ceylan Crêperie

description: A legendary figure on Colombo's secondhand book scene, Deen the Bookman has a vast selection of titles, from run-of-the-mills & boons to obscure medical titles.
name: Deen The Bookman
Achcharu Kadé
description: The Achcharu Kadé is a popular stall that sells good quality, relatively upscale achcharu.

name: Foody Goody
description: Foody Goody, one of Good Market's favourites, sells totally natural, preservative/additive-free ice-cream made at home.
address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Racecourse, Colombo 7

description: If you have a penchant for birds, nature and general chilling on a canoe, this is the place to be.
name: Hambegamuwa Lake
Mamas Galle Fort Roof Café (Galle)
description: The new Mama's remains a good spot for a beer or lime soda, but for rice and curry it's below average.

name: Kottuville (CLOSED)
description: TEMPORARILY CLOSED. So quirky Kottu is a permanent Colombo fixture now. Literally, because the Kottuville truck has dropped its wheels and set up shop in a convertainer adjoining the Union Place Keells Super.

name: Waterscape (Kingsbury)
address: The Kingsbury Hotel, Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 1.
description: The Kingsbury’s poolside restaurant, the Waterscape offers a pretty great view (for now) and al fresco dining. If you’re looking for a decent grill or a bit of fun fondue and have a bit of cash to spare, this place is worth it.
If you're into history, this 1757 church is an important part of Colombo. It's heavy, lasting architecture that they don't make anymore and we think it's worth a visit.
name: Wolvendaal Church (Christian Reformed)

description: Gerard Mendis Chocolatier is a fancy chocolate manufacturer on Horton Place that also offers a range of other desserts. While they charge a premium for their bite-sized chocolates, we found very little we actually enjoyed, and wished we had gone for a bar of Snickers instead. (And as for their cheesecake, don’t even get us started.)
name: Gerard Mendis Chocolatier

description: This is a great beach if you’re looking for a secluded place to chill out and watch the sunset, etc. You can also bring your car right up to the sand at some points, so it makes for a great seaside picnic setting too.
name: Uswetakeiyawa Beach
Java Lounge
description: Java Lounge in Jawatta has become our go to spot for casual meetings or we just want to grab a quick coffee. They've got an accessible location, some surprisingly good pasta dishes and coffee that hits the spot more often than not.
The Racecourse 2 is a wonderful physical addition to the space but, like Racecourse 1, the shops are somewhat underwhelming
name: Colombo Racecourse 2

description: The Nail Anatomy is a nail salon on Reid Avenue, located inside Lakpahana, just opposite the Colombo Racecourse. They offer highly professional service nail and spa services.
name: The Nail Anatomy

description: Octagonal in shape with quaint yellow windows set against brick painted white, the Dondra Lighthouse stands fifty metres tall at the edge of a shady and well-kept garden
name: Dondra Head Lighthouse

description: Shirohana is an upscale outlet which has probably the most branches around Colombo. The Shirohana Romantica covers Havelock Town and the Colombo 5 area pretty good. Besides that your closest bet is Blooms on High Level Road near Nugegoda or their other outlet on Alfred House.
name: Shirohana Romantica

description: An old favourite, Wijaya Beach continues to serve up fresh seafood, excellent pizza and a sun-dappled ocean view.
name: Wijaya Beach

description: Fortaleza is a nice modern addition to the Galle Fort. They have simple and tasty food, excellent service and a beautiful, hip location. We wish it was in Colombo.
name: Fortaleza
Upali's
description: Upali's does affordable and tasty Sri Lankan food.

name: Sri Siam
description: Sri Siam on W.A. Silva Mawatha is yet another new Thai restaurant. We had high hopes since it's run by Thai management, but the food just wasn't up to par.

name: Udumbara JU Caterers
description: JU Caterers is an awesome rice & curry place - they combine tasteful ambience with bath kade prices.

name: Foodie Adventure
description: Foodie Adventure is a home cook in Nawala that does take away and delivery. We tried a bunch of her stuff and pretty much all of it was amazing. Which isn't something we say often.

The Silva Treehouse is an amazing AirBnB getaway in Unawatuna. It's basically a beautiful large glasshouse - quiet, clean, with a soothing green view of surrounding jungle and the ocean in the distance.
name: Silva Tree

description: This Hikkaduwa institution does decent Italian.
name: Spaghetti & Co
Lil' Orbits (Majestic City)
description: Lil' Orbits is an awesome place to go to for your sugar cravings. The prices are alright and the chocolate sauce is gold.

name: Cafe Domus
description: Domus is a small cafe across from the Galle Face Hotel. It does tasty food in a pretty chill atmosphere. It's not super cheap, but not super expensive either.

name: OZO Kandy
description: OZO is a big, modern hotel in the Kandy city center. The restaurant and the roof bar are worth checking out.

name: Grand Thai (Grand Hotel, NE)
description: Grand Thai is a relatively new Thai restaurant which resides at the former basement of The Grand Hotel. Taking the experience as a whole, we were very impressed. Good food, beautiful interior and some impeccable service.
It’s called the swimming club, so this ought to be a good place for a swim - and it is. Apart from splashing it out in the pool, you can also dive into their excellent club-level food.
name: The Colombo Swimming Club

description: Adma Agro in Nuwara Eliya is well known for their fresh strawberries and strawberry products. The store itself isn't in the best shape, but thankfully their desserts are still pretty tasty.
name: Adma Agro
Navratna (Taj)
address: 25, Taj Samudra Hotel, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
description: Navratna, the Taj's Indian restaurant, is one of the few great places in the city for an authentic Indian dining experience.
City Beds is a budget hotel in Colombo, cosy, traveler-friendly and in a very central location.
address: 20, Regent Building, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 1
name: City Beds

description: Room Service is one of the more efficient delivery services around. Their delivery charges are higher than most others but they deliver from some high profile restaurants that you can't get otherwise.
name: Room Service Deliveries

description: Copper Chimney, the Hunupitiya branch appears to be the original in what has now become a franchise. This is an underrated lunch time only fried-rice kade.
name: Copper Chimney (Hunupitiya)
Chop Chop Kottu
description: Chop Chop does tasty, generous kottu all day, via drive through or delivery. Win.
The Nail Anatomy is a nail salon on Reid Avenue, located inside Lakpahana, just opposite the Colombo Racecourse. They offer highly professional service nail and spa services.
name: The Nail Anatomy

description: Sri Vihar (formerly known as Shanthi Vihar) is a well-known vegetarian Indian restaurant located at the Thummulla Junction. Veering towards the south Indian side of things, they offer the standard selection of dosas, thalis and idlis as well as some north Indian dishes.
name: Sri Vihar
Aahaara
description: Aahaara is a caterer that does wood-fired biriyani and rice and curry.

name: Sri Suryas
description: Crammed into a congested street in Pettah, Sri Suryas is an unassuming restaurant that serves a mean ghee dosa, among other things.

name: Hotel Bankshall
description: Open from the crack of dawn till midnight, this is a great, clean rice-and- curry stop with quail on the menu.

name: & Co. (The Steuart)
address: 45 Janadhipathi Mw, Colombo 1 (entrance on Hospital Ln)
description: &Co is a new pub and restaurant tucked in the Steuart Hotel behind Dutch Hospital. They serve up good, hefty pub fare in a spacious setting.

name: Machang (Koswatta)
description: මචං, යමුද කොස්වත්තෙ මචං එකට බියර් එකක් ගහන්න.

name: Giovanni's
description: Giovanni's is a little Italian pizza place run by a chef who uses his own recipes, and serves fresh from a clay oven.
Spread over a  25-acre property that skirts a reservoir and thick jungle, Cinnamon Lodge in Habarana is an excellent place to get lost in for a few days.
name: Cinnamon Lodge Habarana

description: A saivar down Havelock Road (and just a short walk from Duplication Road), this place is affordable and accessible.
name: Ananda Bhavan

description: The Prithipura Communities is an organisation dedicated to the care and assistance of children with disabilities.
address: Prithipura Infants Home, Prithipura Road, Hendala, Wattala
name: Prithipura Communities
Grande Gourmet at Nirj's
description: Try-hard decadence that's not worth your money. Faux fine dining.

name: Kinnaree
description: The menu features more than just Thai food. Lunch deals include stroganof and caeser salad. Decent value, good ambience.

name: Flower Drum
description: Good ambience, decent food, over-rated chili paste. Okay value for groups.
Cool Berry is where the Juice Bar used to be. Despite their name and the extensive range of juices and smoothies on the menu, they don't have half of it.
name: Cool Berry
Atrium Restaurant
description: Atrium is a Japanese/Fast Food restaurant in Thalawathugoda

name: Far East Indonesian Cuisine
description: From regulars like Nasi Goreng and Mee Goreng, this place also dishes out a pretty great beef rendang.

name: Cafe Michaelangelo
description: Thin crust, wood-fired pizza, with toppings like Pol Sambol. Michaelangelo is good for delivery, if you're really patient.

name: Margie's Kitchen
description: Margie's Kitchen is a home cook in Mount Lavinia that specializes in Dutch Burgher and Portuegse influenced local dishes. While they offer a variety of dishes, most of it revolves around pork, and their briliant black pork curry is the coup de grâce.

name: Little Italy in Colombo (Caffitaly)
description: Little Italy in Colombo is a modest little Italian cafe in Wellawatta that serves up Italian staples along with a decent selection of coffees.

name: Quick Thai (Battaramulla)
description: Quick Thai serves up a range of affordable Thai dishes that are low on refinement, yet big on taste, from its modest, but elegant Pelawatta premises.

name: Indo Ceylon Cafe
description: Their coconut chutney lifts to high heavens an otherwise mediocre array of South Indian staples.
Tsing Tao is a fine dinning Chinese restaurant that strikes a good a balance between authentic and Sri Lankanized Chinese, in a chic and elegant setting.
name: Tsing Tao (Colombo Racecourse)
address: Race Course Promenade, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7

name: Coco Veranda (Crescat Boulevard)
address: G-09, Crescat Boulevard, Galle Road, Colombo 03
description: Coco V at Crescat offers the same stuff as the Coco V at Ward Place, but the ambience isn't as chilled out as the other. Their signatures are coffees and cakes.

name: Seasons
address: Liberty Plaza, Level 2, 250, R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
description: Authentic biryani at affordable prices, Seasons is only held back by its dismal setting on the deserted second floor of Liberty Plaza.
This Facebook group has fast become one of the best places to find or sell quality furniture. Also a place for the exchange of puppies, property, etc.
name: Ex-Pats Furniture Service
China Doll
description: China Doll, once a fresh entry into the Chinese Restaurant tamasha is no longer the jaw dropping experience it once was.

name: Java Lounge
description: Java Lounge in Jawatta has become our go to spot for casual meetings or we just want to grab a quick coffee. They've got an accessible location, some surprisingly good pasta dishes and coffee that hits the spot more often than not.
Barista Gandhara has moved and been renamed to Cafe Mocha.
name: Barista Lavazza (Gandhara)

description: Lantern is a well-equipped boutique hotel in Mirissa.
name: Lantern (Mirissa)
Currymuch
description: If you're working around Slave Island or Fort, Curry Much does a decent buth packet with better packaging.

name: Navratna (Taj)
address: 25, Taj Samudra Hotel, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
description: Navratna, the Taj's Indian restaurant, is one of the few great places in the city for an authentic Indian dining experience.
Curve, at Park Street Mews, is a tapas bar that's been around for a couple of years. While the purple-white theme is looking a bit old now, their tapas and drinks are still pretty good.
name: Curve
Sea Fish Restaurant & Bar
address: 15, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
description: Sea Fish is a restaurant that's been around since the '70s, and its dining space still features music and lights from that era. Their seafood is however good, and they also do seafood BBQs in their backyard on request.

name: Zephyr (Arugam Bay)
address: Siam View Hotel, Panama Road, Arugam Bay
description: Zephyr is a branch of the Mirissa spot. They do quite good food and drinks here.
Montage would have ranked as ok chinese seafood until I uncovered something inside the dish.
name: Montage
Reef House Cafe
description: Reef House Cafe is a small shack of a restaurant on Mount Beach. It's got an undeniably dodgy feel to it, but the food isn't terrible and they do serve booze. That plus the fact that they're open well into the night makes this a popular spot for a meetup.
Colombo Fort Cafe is a Harpo's run restaurant located in the popular Dutch Hospital shopping complex, serving up delicious pizzas, pastas and burgers.
name: Colombo Fort Cafe (Dutch Hospital)
address: Dutch Hospital,  Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1

description: Park Street Mews Restaurant is one of those select few that have managed to remain relevant and maintain high standards throughout the years. They haven't changed much at all, but we're fine with that since the food is excellent, the service is fast and the unorthodox setting is still quite chic.
name: Park Street Mews Restaurant

description: Ah, Fab. It's been around longer than we can remember - since 1979 to be precise - and has consistently been keeping Colombo happy with their short eats, cakes and sweets.
name: The Fab
Cake Whisperer
description: Cake Whisperer is yet another good Colombo home-baker. They do simple, sweet cupcakes mostly - some of the best butter-cream frosting ones we've had.

name: Red Snapper
description: Red Snapper is a seafood restaurant at the Dutch Hospital that does a range of crab and lobster preparations. It's a formal dining place that plays a lot of '90s saxophone music and serves OK food.

name: Cookies & You
description: Cookies and You claims to deliver Love at First Bite, and they live up to this promise. Their baked goods taste as great as their Instagram feed looks.
A children's home for sixty underprivileged boys
address: Sri Jinananda Children's Home Sri Sugatha Viharaya,  No1, Dharmarama Road, Wellawatte
name: Sri Jinananda Children's Home

description: While it's not quite as charming as Maradana's second hand strip it's much better laid out and the books seems to be curated- classics at the back, pulp and pop towards the front and a box of more serious contemporary novels on one side.
name: Senanayake Book Shop

description: Lipton's Seat, located in Dambethenna Estate in Haputhale, has amazing panoramic views and is a worthwhile hike.
name: Lipton's Seat (Haputale)
Government Service Sports Club
description: Serving the best handallo in town, the GSSC is a dodgy bar with cheap drinks and decent patrons.
Not so much a safari as a long boat ride, sailing on the picturesque Koggala Lake is an immensely enjoyable weekend experience.
name: Koggala Lake Safari

description: China Doll's got a new location and they serve up pretty decent food.
name: China Doll
Simply Strawberries By Jagro
description: This location is closed, their other locations (Kotte, Cotton Collection) are open. Simply Strawberries by Jagro is a great place for sugary, strawberry-centric desserts that are huge in portion size and high in quality.

name: Indian Chaat Corner
description: Indian Chaat Corner is a tiny barely-noticeable restaurant that specializes in Indian street food. The chaat is still pretty good, and they've got a nicer interior now.

name: Tiffin Hut (Grand Oriental Hotel)
description: Though reliable, the tiffin hut doesn't have the tastiest food in Fort.
Queen's Cafe is a very popular fast food stop down Duplication Road that's been around for ages. It was closed for a while awaiting a face lift, but it's now open for business again.
name: Queen's Cafe
Sen Saal (Battaramulla)
description: Sen Saal was one of the very first large scale bakeries to establish themselves in Battaramulla. Since then they have added a restaurant at the back where they serve things like Lasgna, Rice and Curry, Nasi Goreng, Fried Rice and even the elusive Lamprais. They also do submarines and fresh fruit juices. Having lived in Battaramulla for so many years now, I was excited about writing a good review to rep the town. But oh my god, this is going to be the furthest thing from a good review!

name: Flamingo House
description: The aptly-named Flamingo House is the newest—and probably funkiest— addition to Colombo’s restaurant repertoire. The food is inconsistent but interesting, but the excellent cocktails and crazy interior win brownie points.

name: The Silver Spoon
description: The Silver Spoon is a quality buth kade in Ratmalana that serves wholesome food at decent prices. (Steer clear of the meat, though)

name: In Doo Se Restaurant
description: In Doo Se is an Indian Restaurant situated in Thalawathugoda. It's a wonderful place to enjoy a pure Indian meal with a good service.

name: No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop (Mirissa)
description: Mirissa seems to love its roti, and no one does it better than No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop. It's a small, family-run restaurant that offers an impressive variety of dishes, along with some of the best savoury and sweet rotis we've had.

name: Kami Maki
description: Kami Maki is a Japanese fusion restaurant in Bamabalapitiya. While it's not the most authentic Japanese in town, they do offer some interesting fusion dishes.

Hangover Hostel is a convenient and inexpensive lodging option for those looking to travel to Mirissa on a budget. It's a simple little space but they've got the essentials covered. They've got private rooms and dorms, both priced very reasonably.
name: Hangover Hostel (Mirissa)
The Mango Tree
description: Mango Tree is a hugely popular Indian restaurant on Dharmapala Mawatha, serving mainly North Indian cuisine. The food is very rich, and quite good.
One of the lesser-known attractions of Colombo, the Maritime Museum has the potential to be interesting. For now, it is mostly dingy and poorly-lit.
address: 19, Sri Lanka Ports Authority, Chaithya Road, Colombo 1
name: Colombo Maritime Museum
Nelum Kole
description: Nelum Kole is a rice-and-curry kade in Boralesgamuwa that provides a convenient and cost-effective lunch spread.

name: Rasa Bojun
description: This is a new buth kade off Havelock Road, near Thumulla. It's basically average.

name: The Sandwich Factory (Colombo 3)
description: Sandwich Factory does a filling take  on western diner favorites.

name: Mirissa Beach Wadiya
description: So Mirissa's got their own Beach Wadiya (though not associated with Colombo's Wadiya). They offer a decent variety of seafood with an emphasis on the day's catch. The execution, however, was inconsistent.

name: Mr. Kottu Restaurant
description: Have you tried Hopper Kottu? Mr. Kottu is the place to go.
address: No. 243, Thalawathugoda Road, Wijitha Pura, Pitakotte

name: Aahaara
description: Aahaara is a caterer that does wood-fired biriyani and rice and curry.
Amanté is an MAS brand selling an excellent selection of high quality lingerie at the Colombo Racecourse.
address: GS 6, The Colombo Racecourse, Philip Gunewardena Mawatha, Colombo 7
name: Amanté
Thalis
description: Serving both north and south Indian thalis in addition to a la carte dishes, this all-vegetarian eatery is authentic and affordable — two adjectives we love a little more than others.
B's Delights is relatively new, having started up just a couple of months ago. They do cakey brownies with interesting twists.
name: B's Delights
address: Delivery or pick up from Dehiwela or Bambalapitiya

description: TEMPORARILY CLOSED: Che Che's is a new home-based take-out venture specializing in Chinese dumplings and steamed buns. It may still be in its infancy, but their food is delicious and incredibly affordable. The only caveat is that they're located in Palawatta, but we think it's well worth the trip.
name: Che Che's

description: This rarely open museum has an interesting collection of stuff seized by the customs department, from leopard skin to ivory to bugs.
name: Customs Museum

description: This rarely open museum has an interesting collection of stuff seized by the customs department, from leopard skin to ivory to bugs.
name: Customs Museum
Royal Burger
description: Royal Burger is a very reliable stop on Havelock Road for cheese dripping, affordable burgers and subs. It's a popular lunch option among the RI students in the neighborhood.
The Dining Room specializes in international buffets at Cinnamon Lakeside.
name: The Dining Room (Cinnamon Lakeside)
address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115, Sir Chittampalam A.Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02

name: Oshella
description: Oshella is a home cook who specializes in chocolatey desserts. Literally everything we tried was excellent, but her eclairs in particular were the best we've had in Colombo.

name: McDonald's (Welisara)
description: There's a McDonald's outside of Colombo as well.
You'll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breads, biscuits and baked goods at this Jaffna bakery and cafe.
name: Thinesh Bake House

description: Located near Passara, Badulla, Namunukula peak is the 12th highest in Sri Lanka
name: Namunukula

description: This online shop has a wide selection of beer, wine and liquor and the lowest prices you can get.
name: Wine World
The Palmyrah House
address: Thalaimannar Road, Karisal, Mannar Island, Mannar
description: The Palmyrah House is one of the few  proper hotels in Mannar.  The management has embraced the island's flora and fauna, creating an eco-friendly boutique hotel that offers a memorable experience.
Lipton's Seat, located in Dambethenna Estate in Haputhale, has amazing panoramic views and is a worthwhile hike.
name: Lipton's Seat (Haputale)
The Fab (Wattala)
description: Fab is one of the older and more established bakeries in town. The franchise is well known for its cakes.
A home-catering service with a difference, Contemporary Ceylon is one of the city's best-kept secrets.
name: Contemporary Ceylon
address: Colombo 3. You can book a dinner by appointment only.

description: Heladiv Tea Club is one of Dutch Hospital's many eateries. We've been there a few times and we've come to enjoy it as a quiet hang out for a quick bite or dessert. While slightly unconventional, it's also a great place for drinks, which is what this review is all about.
name: Heladiv Tea Club (Bar)
address: Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1

name: Mintage Restaurant & Pub
description: A chilled out place in the heart of Colombo for a nibble and drink after work with friends, which doesn't require you to dress up or shell out serious dough.
Off The Hook is a fresh seafood restaurant and bar  located on Park Road run by the same management as The Bavarian German Restaurant.
name: Off The Hook

description: Cremalato is a local gelato manufacturer that actually delivers frozen confections.  We tried a bunch of their new flavours and we think they're pretty awesome.
name: Cremalato
Dilmah t-Lounge
description: Dilmah's charming tea lounge in the shadow of Dutch Hospital is still going strong, with a range of hot and cold teas and little and large bites.

name: Panino (Cotton Collection)
description: Panino specialises in sandwiches. In melts, to be specific. They also have a killer hot sauce.

name: The Lagoon (Cinnamon Grand)
description: The Lagoon is a fine dining seafood restaurant located in Colombo's Cinnamon Grand Hotel. Freshly caught seafood is displayed upon a bed of ice and can be chosen with the preferred style of preparation and sides. It's very good, and very expensive.
An old favourite, Wijaya Beach continues to serve up fresh seafood, excellent pizza and a sun-dappled ocean view.
name: Wijaya Beach
Loft Lounge (Colombo Courtyard)
description: The Loft Lounge and Cloud Cafe are Colombo Courtyard's two-in-one bar combo. The former is indoors while the latter is on the rooftop. As far as cocktails go, CC fares quite well, but the food leaves much to be desired.
Il Ponte at Hilton is one of the older Italian restaurants in Colombo. It may not be as popular as it was back in the day, but their Italian fare is pretty solid all-round.
name: Il Ponte (Hilton)
address: 2, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 01

name: Hotel De Pilawoos (Kollupitiya)
description: Hotel de Pilawoos, one of the many Hotel de Pilawoos, is probably the best Hotel de Pilwaoos in town.

name: The Gourmet Station (The Kingsbury)
description: Thé Cake is a bakery-cum-mini confectionery outlet located at The Kingsbury. It offers baked goodies and chocolates.
Il Ponte at Hilton is one of the older Italian restaurants in Colombo. It may not be as popular as it was back in the day, but their Italian fare is pretty solid all-round.
name: Il Ponte (Hilton)
address: 2, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 01

name: Dhawalagiri Hotel
description: The Dhawalagiri is a typical saivar kadey, where you can drop in to get a quick, oily bite. It's in central Maradana, you can't miss it.
address: 433, P de S Kularatne Mawatha, Colombo 10

name: MOMO
description: MoMo's has an extensive menu ranging from naans to lasagna to seafood and pastas. It has a nice, comfy interior, and is a vibrant space for families.

name: Strikes Cosmic Bowling
address: Excel World, 338 T.B Jayah Mawatha, Colombo 10
description: This bowling alley in Excel World is nothing fancy, but fun enough.
Wonderbar is a sweet-toothed vegan's dream come true. They offer you gluten, sugar, and dairy-free desserts and smoothies,
name: Wonderbar

description: Latheruma does a really tasty and cheap rice and curry lunch.
name: Lantheruma (The Lantern)
address: De Fonseka Road, near Vajira Junction

name: Shamrock
description: Shamrock is a new Irish pub that’s opened up alongside Red Snapper. We’re not huge fans of their club area, but the lounge at the back makes for a cozy hangout spot, plus, they serve up some excellent cocktails.

name: Pizza Hut (Attidiya)
description: We all like the occasional slice of unorthodox pizza. But is Pizza Hut really worth the buck you're paying for it? Somewhat.
Meemure is an isolated village in the Knuckles range in Kandy. It's rich in natural beauty.
name: Meemure

description: CocoCeylon is a mysterious business that we spotted only on Instagram. They offer overpriced smoothies and chia puddings.
name: CocoCeylon
Seoul
description: Seoul is a bright, sunlit, spanking new addition to the (mostly cheerless) Korean restaurants in the city.

name: Rakna Lanka (Diyawanna Kotthu Hut)
description: Just opposite the Diyawanna Jogging Track car park is the newly built army kotthu shop. This is the closest place for joggers to come and have a bite after a light workout. They do a chicken and egg kotthu, and that pretty much sums up the whole menu. They do however have a convenient little shop which sells biscuits, soft drinks and even cigarettes.
This is the city’s rising late-night kottu star.
name: Hotel De Plaza
address: Corner of St Anthony's Road and Galle Road, Colombo 3

name: Candy Planet (Liberty Arcade)
description: At long last, Candy Planet has opened up a new branch at the Liberty Arcade in Colpetty. The best part is that they've got some awesome additions like Reese's products, Sour Patch Kids and a bunch of new chocolates.

name: Chop Chop Kottu
description: Chop Chop does tasty, generous kottu all day, via drive through or delivery. Win.

name: Hotel New Amirthaa
description: A YAMU office favourite, Amirthaa in Bamba does a mean Ghee dosa. It also serves Bonda, Jelebi and fresh milk with a dash of tea.

name: The Cake Factory (5th Lane)
